intro: Pharmacum intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate pharmacum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role in the environment. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
